mav_sim.message_types.msg_world_map module¶

msg_map

  • messages type for map of the world

part of mavsim_python

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Last update:

    4/10/2019 - RWB

class mav_sim.message_types.msg_world_map.MsgWorldMap(city_width: float = 2000.0, num_city_blocks: int = 5, building_max_height: float = 300.0, street_width: float = 0.8, building_heights: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Defines the world map

set_heights(building_heights: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] | None = None) → None¶

Sets the building heights. If no heights are provided then they are produced randomly.

Parameters:

building_heights – Heights of each building. If no heights are provided then they will be randomly generated

mav_sim.message_types.msg_world_map.map_height(world_map: MsgWorldMap, point: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → float¶

find the height of point at ground level

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • point – location in ned to calculate height of the ground (in enu frame)

Returns:

Height of ground at (north,east) position (i.e., the up value in the enu frame)

Return type:

map_height
